alert.note: Alert for Sublette (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 8:06PM MDT until June 20 at 10:45PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Wyoming, including the following county, Sublette, along and near Pine Creek. * WHEN...Until 800 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Water flow may change quickly. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 755 PM MDT, emergency management and river gauge measurements indicated increases in river stage and water flow along Pine Creek. Recent rainfall and melting snow will lead to minor flooding along and near Pine Creek. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Pine Creek, Pole Creek Ditch, Soda Lake Drain, New Fork River and Fremont Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pinedale, Fremont Lake and Fremont Lake Campground.
info.instruction: Minor flooding is occurring or is imminent. Campers and hikers should be cautious near streams or creeks, as water flow may change quickly. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
